strings.Value: "You know, when I forged an alliance with a mysterious undead companion, I never imagined how valuable you would become, and how much we'd go through together."
"Are you afraid of the upcoming battle? You're not one to risk your life for a good cause."
"It's time. A battle with the Eldest awaits."
{n}Jaethal stands still, her face calm as glassy water. And yet you feel the tension in her pose, like a drawn bowstring.{/n} "We're ready to march, are we not? At last. This waiting is exhausting."

"It's not the first time I've heard someone praise my skills, but hearing it from you is especially enjoyable. You are an excellent leader. I hope you know that's not flattery — I don't flatter and I'm no good at it. It's just a sign of respect — from one worthy companion to another."

"I know the wrath and mercy of true deities. The games of the {g|First World}First World{/g} pretender don't scare me. And yes, you are absolutely right about me. However, I value justified risk and mutually beneficial alliance. No serious goals can be achieved without them."
"Point me to the goal. I'll handle the rest... One way or another."
